The Tracker offers a comprehensive understanding of how peace processes are unfolding, identifies the stakeholders involved, and assesses the impact of these processes across a range of institutional, political, economic, humanitarian, and security indicators.

fields.Org Description: Queen’s University Belfast positions itself as a research-intensive institution supported by strong engineering, medicine, and social science faculties, contributing to technological innovation, public health research, and regional economic development while maintaining structured links with government and industry.

fields.Project Description: PeaceRep distributes the PA-X Tracker, an innovative digital tool designed to provide data-driven insights that support peace and transition processes. The suite of PeaceTech tools within the PA-X Tracker enables users to track and monitor the progress and implementation of peace and transition initiatives. The Tracker offers a comprehensive understanding of how peace processes are unfolding, identifies the stakeholders involved, and assesses the impact of these processes across a range of institutional, political, economic, humanitarian, and security indicators.

fields.Org Description: Arab Barometer is a nonpartisan research network that provides insight into the social, political, and economic attitudes and values of ordinary citizens across the Arab world. We have been conducting high quality and reliable public opinion surveys in the Middle East and North Africa since 2006. We are the longest-standing and the largest repository of publicly available data on the views of men and women in the MENA region. Our findings give a voice to the needs and concerns of Arab publics.

fields.Project Description: The Arab Pulse was founded in 2018 to provide an outlet for political discussion on the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) based on quantitative research. The MENA region is in constant flux and faces new and old challenges. The Arab Pulse represents a central nexus for empirical and data-driven research focused on contemporary MENA politics, society, and values, engaging scholars, policymakers, and the media from the region and beyond.

The data analysis tool enables researchers without access to statistical software packages to perform simple descriptive analyses across all Arab Barometer waves and countries. Results can be downloaded in multiple formats and easily integrated into reports, articles, and presentations.

Provides harmonized survey data covering public opinion on governance, religion, and economics in more than 20 Arab countries. The data is freely accessible and supports comparative analysis across the region.

name: IFRC: International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent

fields.Org Full Name: IFRC: International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
fields.Org Description: The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) is the world's largest humanitarian organization, with 190 member National Societies. As part of the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement, our work is guided by seven fundamental principles; humanity, impartiality, neutrality, independence, voluntary service, unity and universality.
fields.Org IATI Name: International Federation of the Red Cross and Red Crescent (IFRC)

fields.Project Description: GUARD delivers rapid vulnerability analysis for at-risk populations in sudden-onset disasters through an automated web tool and open-source event dataset. This drives real-time insights, equitable resource allocation, and inclusive, evidence-based response plans. CRAF’d finances the tool and dataset development, rigorous validation, and integration into national disaster management frameworks f

Trigger models are employed to establish danger levels that activate humanitarian anticipatory Early Action Protocols (EAPs). These models are developed using the Impact-Based Forecasting (IBF) methodology. Models have been built to trigger EAPs for hazards such as typhoon, flood, dzud, drought, and dengue. This approach supports the Enhanced Vulnerability and Capacity Assessment (EVCA) by providing a systematic and evidence-based process for determining when early action should be taken in response to specific risks.

Trigger models are employed to establish danger levels that activate humanitarian anticipatory Early Action Protocols (EAPs). These models are developed using the Impact-Based Forecasting (IBF) methodology. Models have been built to trigger EAPs for hazards such as typhoon, flood, dzud, drought, and dengue.

PHASI® is a data integration and analysis platform developed by the American Red Cross that aggregates multi-sectoral indicators to identify public health and safety risks. It supports disaster planning, resource allocation, and early warning efforts.

fields.Org Description: The Joint Research Centre (JRC) is the European Commission's science and knowledge service which employs scientists to carry out research in order to provide independent scientific advice and support to European Union (EU) policy.

fields.Project/Product Name: Global Disaster Alert and Coordination System (GDACS)
fields.Project Description: The Global Disaster Alert and Coordination System (GDACS) is a cooperation framework between the United Nations, the European Commission, and disaster managers worldwide. Its purpose is to improve alerts, facilitate information exchange, and enhance coordination during the initial phase following major sudden-onset disasters.

INFORM Climate Change Risk Index is an upgrade of the INFORM Risk Index as it includes climate and socio-economic projections. It provides quantified estimates of the impacts of climate change on the future risk of humanitarian crises and disasters. The results are intended to inform policy choices across climate mitigation, climate adaptation, disaster risk reduction, sustainable development, and humanitarian assistance.

Epidemic Intelligence from Open Sources (EIOS) is a real-time platform developed by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the European Commission to collect, verify, and share public health threat information from open sources. The platform provides a centralized dashboard and alerting system designed to assist health agencies in monitoring emerging epidemics and coordinating responses.

GloFAS – Global Flood Awareness System, developed by the European Commission’s Joint Research Centre (EC-JRC) and the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF), provides open-access flood forecasts and risk assessments. It integrates global hydrological models to support early warning systems and flood preparedness planning.

The INFORM Risk Index is a multi-hazard risk assessment tool developed by the Inter-Agency Standing Committee (IASC) and the European Commission. It combines data on hazards, vulnerability, and coping capacity to produce a composite score of disaster risk in over 190 countries. The index supports evidence-based disaster preparedness, humanitarian planning, and crisis response by identifying countries most at risk of crises that could overwhelm national response capacities. It is updated annually and incorporates more than 50 indicators.

name: UNCCD: United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification

fields.Org Full Name: UNCCD: United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification
fields.Org Description: The UNCCD is the global voice for land. We promote practices that avoid, reduce and reverse land degradation and are the driving force behind Sustainable Development Goal 15 and Land Degradation Neutrality.

fields.Project Description: Desertification Country Profiles provide standardized national overviews of land degradation, drought planning, and sustainable land management actions under the UNCCD. The platform offers quick access to country information, annex classifications, national and regional action plans, and voluntary Land Degradation Neutrality (LDN) targets to support coordinated, evidence-based land stewardship.

fields.Org Description: The World Meteorological Organization fosters the international exchange and standardization of meteorological and hydrological data, crucial for weather forecasting, climate monitoring, and water resource management. Their World Climate Data and Monitoring Programme (WCDMP) coordinates climate data and assessment, while initiatives like data rescue projects, including the MEditerranean climate DAta REscue (MEDARE) project and the International Environmental Data Rescue Organization (IEDRO), work to digitize historical data for research and analysis. The WMO also implements the WMO Hydrological Observing System (WHOS) through the WMO HydroHub to facilitate data sharing and capacity building in hydrology.

fields.Project Description: WWIS is a centralized WMO platform that provides authoritative city-level weather forecasts and climate summaries, sourced from national meteorological and hydrological services. It supports risk awareness and decision-making by offering free, real-time access to standardized global weather data.

name: UNDRR: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction

fields.Org Full Name: UNDRR: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction
fields.Org Description: The United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNDRR) has a big ambition: to help decision makers across the globe better understand and act on risk.  At UNDRR, we envision a world where disasters no longer threaten the well-being of people and the future of the planet. Sustainable development and the 2030 Agenda cannot be achieved without working towards that goal of building resilience.

fields.Project Description: Datum is a centralized portal that provides free, open-access databases and RESTful APIs to support disaster risk reduction (DRR) efforts worldwide. All datasets and metadata are available for download or querying under UNDRR’s terms, with the requirement of proper attribution. The portal’s content is organized into several thematic “data clusters,” each of which is versioned and paginated to facilitate easy integration.

name: UNHCR: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

fields.Org Full Name: UNHCR: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
fields.Org Description: UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organization dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for people forced to flee their homes because of conflict and persecution. We lead international action to protect refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people.
fields.Org IATI Name: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

fields.Project/Product Name: WASH Knowledge, Attitudes and Practices (KAP) Survey
fields.Project Description: Routine monitoring of the WASH services provided is paramount for quality assurance, ensuring the set standards are met within stipulated timelines, challenges are identified in time, and solutions are sought. UNHCR (Cox’s Bazar Field Office) conducted the third round of its WASH Knowledge, Attitude and Practice (KAP) survey from 15th to 23rd November 2023 in UNHCR’s area of operation in Kutupalong and Teknaf. Five WASH partners implemented the survey.

The UNHCR Global Data Service (GDS) serves as a central hub for data and statistics on refugees, asylum-seekers, internally displaced persons (IDPs), and stateless individuals. It supports evidence-based decision-making, policy development, and humanitarian operations by providing access to a wide range of data tools and resources.

The database contains information about forcibly displaced populations, compiled from over 70 years of statistical activities. It includes data on various displaced groups such as refugees, asylum-seekers, and internally displaced people, along with their demographic characteristics. The database also covers stateless individuals, most of whom have never experienced displacement. Additionally, it provides information on different solutions for displaced populations, including repatriation and resettlement.

This report presents UNHCR’s engagement in multi-sectoral joint needs assessments in 2020, in accordance with Grand Bargain commitments aimed at improving the harmonization and coordination of assessment exercises, as well as increasing transparency for the asset Joint Needs Assessments (JNA).

The UNHCR Statistical Online Population Database provides a comprehensive summary of changes in global trends and levels concerning populations of interest to UNHCR. This includes refugees, asylum-seekers, returned refugees, internally displaced persons (IDPs) protected or assisted by UNHCR, returned IDPs, stateless persons, and other groups of concern. The information is reported by UNHCR country offices and generally reflects data provided by the host country.

fields.Project/Product Name: World Bank-UNHCR Joint Data Center on Forced Displacement
fields.Project Description: The World Bank-UNHCR Joint Data Center on Forced Displacement (JDC) is a joint initiative dedicated to improving the collection, analysis, and use of data on forcibly displaced populations. The JDC provides public goods such as surveys, microdata, and research, all focused on informing development and humanitarian action through evidence-based approaches.

The Operational Data Portal (ODP) enables UNHCR to fulfill its institutional responsibility by providing an information and data sharing platform that facilitates coordination during refugee emergencies. This is accomplished through the use of independent ‘situation views’ that cover major emergencies, such as the Syria situation and the Central African Republic emergency, among others, ensuring comprehensive and accessible data management for effective humanitarian response.
An archive of anonymized survey and refugee data available under open-access licenses, supporting demographic and displacement research across global contexts.

UNHCR’s case management and registration system manages refugee and asylum-seeker data. The platform supports operational planning, registration, and data interoperability across protection and assistance programs.

RAIS is a digital system designed for monitoring and coordinating assistance in refugee operations. It supports operations by registering aid delivery and tracking service provision across various displacement contexts.

fields.Project/Product Name: Population Registration and Identity Management EcoSystem (PRIMES)
fields.Project Description:
At the center of UNHCR’s work with registration and identity management is PRIMES, the digital Population Registration and Identity Management Ecosystem developed by UNHCR. PRIMES integrates all of UNHCR’s digital registration, identity management, and case management tools into a single, internally connected and interoperable ecosystem.

PRIMES consists of several repositories for personal data, including both biographic and biometric information, as well as supporting data. It incorporates multiple tools that securely utilize this information to deliver targeted protection, assistance, and solutions to refugees and other displaced populations. PRIMES enables a range of functions, including:

- Identity management, encompassing registration, biometric enrolment, and documentation
- Case management, covering key protection aspects such as Refugee Status Determination, Resettlement, Statelessness, Repatriation, Legal and Physical Protection, Child Protection, Sexual and Gender-Based Violence (SGBV), and others
- Assistance, including both cash and in-kind support
- Data management, which includes reporting and analysis to support evidence-informed action for quality protection outcomes

PRIMES is designed with cooperation and interoperability as core principles, allowing governments and partners supporting refugees to utilize the data and technology developed by UNHCR. This enhances their capacity to deliver services, often in collaboration with UNHCR, in a safe and secure manner. PRIMES is fully aligned with the Policy on the Protection of Personal Data of Persons of Concern to UNHCR.

The 2024 Socio-Economic Insights Survey (SEIS) in Estonia provides a comprehensive assessment of the needs and vulnerabilities of refugees from Ukraine. Conducted as part of an annual interagency regional process led by UNHCR, this assessment supports the Regional Refugee Response Plan (RRP) for the Ukraine Situation. Covering topics such as protection, health, education, shelter, livelihoods, and food security, the survey offers critical data to inform evidence-based planning and prioritization, ensuring the specific needs of different refugee groups are addressed. Data collection was conducted through face-to-face interviews from May to July 2024 with a probability-based random sample of refugee households, managed collaboratively by UNHCR and the International Organization for Migration. Findings will guide strategic interventions and resource allocation to enhance the welfare and resilience of the refugee population in Estonia.

CLIFDEW-GRID, developed by UNHCR in collaboration with the University of California Irvine, is an ambitious initiative dedicated to addressing the complex challenge of climate-induced forced displacement, including through the creation of the first risk index of its kind. This project leverages advanced data analytics and innovative methodologies to enable CRAF’d ecosystem partners to anticipate and respond effectively to the escalating crisis of climate-induced displacement. By providing forecasts at a subnational level, CLIFDEW-GRID offers a more nuanced understanding of in-country heterogeneity compared to traditional country-level approaches. The system will be piloted in selected countries in Western and Eastern Africa.

CLIFDEW-GRID functions as an early warning, grid-based modeling system designed to predict potential climate-induced forced displacement. It is a joint, innovative data project led by UNHCR and the University of California Irvine, with financial support from the Complex Risk Analytics Fund (CRAF’d).

ASR monitors the demographic and socioeconomic profiles of refugee populations worldwide. Its standardized surveys and data visualizations support evidence-based protection, education, and livelihood programming.

The Multi-Sectoral Needs Assessment (MSNA) is a standardized, country-level data collection initiative designed to capture comprehensive multi-sectoral needs among crisis-affected populations. Implemented by IMPACT Initiatives through its REACH Initiative, the MSNA collects statistically representative, household-level data on sectors such as food security, health, shelter, WASH, education, and protection. While the initiative is closely coordinated with OCHA and humanitarian clusters in country-led responses, the technical design, survey implementation, and analysis are primarily led by REACH/IMPACT, with operational support from agencies like IOM , WFP or IMMAP.

fields.Org Description: 3iS’s mission is to empower and enhance the understanding of information through innovative technology, successfully driving strategic change and transforming decision-making. We use data and cutting-edge technology to generate knowledge that equips leaders and change agents to better achieve their objectives in the humanitarian, development, and academic sectors.

fields.Project Description: The approach focuses on optimizing data collection, analysis, and dissemination of information to enable transparent communication and cooperation between stakeholders.

Monitoring and evaluation (M&E) activities are supported as fundamental components for understanding impact, ensuring transparency, and fostering continuous improvements to projects. The objective is to deliver customized, robust frameworks and methodologies specifically designed to capture the outcomes of partners’ initiatives. The most effective M&E processes are considered to be continuous and should be integrated throughout the project wherever feasible. This approach ensures ongoing tracking of progress and transparently communicates the impact of the project to both donors and the communities being supported.

The goal is to empower and equip organizations with the knowledge, skill sets, and tools necessary to overcome challenges, enabling them to respond more effectively in the present and sustain success in the future. Both in-person and remote learning environments are created to foster continuous improvement and innovation, ensuring that partners consistently grow and adapt to change.

Strategy & Systems Development offers a comprehensive suite of services designed to ensure that work is targeted and effective. These services enable organizations to plan strategically, implement operations efficiently, and adapt proactively to dynamic and evolving situations. The primary objective is to establish efficient systems that optimize operations, empowering partners to work smarter rather than harder. This approach encompasses the development and integration of technology to enhance efficiency, scalability, and communication. By streamlining processes, operational costs are reduced and a foundation is laid for sustainable impact.

fields.Org Description:
Afrobarometer, a non-profit company limited by guarantee with headquarters in Ghana, is a pan-African, non-partisan survey research network that conducts public attitude surveys on democracy, governance, the economy, and society. Afrobarometer is the world’s leading source of high-quality data on what Africans are thinking.

The Afrobarometer network encompasses more than 30 national partners responsible for data collection, analysis, and in-country dissemination of findings. Regional coordination is provided by the Ghana Center for Democratic Development (CDD-Ghana), the Institute for Justice and Reconciliation (IJR) in South Africa, and the Institute for Development Studies (IDS) at the University of Nairobi in Kenya. Michigan State University (MSU) and the University of Cape Town (UCT) provide technical support to the network.

fields.Project Description: Afrobarometer is a pan-African public-opinion research network that provides survey insights into democracy, governance, and economic conditions. Survey microdata and analysis tools are publicly available through an open-access portal.

The Online Data Analytics (ODA) tool is a free and user-friendly platform designed to facilitate the discovery, analysis, and utilization of high-quality data on the views and experiences of Africans. The ODA includes data sets from 39 African countries, with records dating back to 1999. Users can search data sets by country, survey question, or survey round. The tool allows for comparisons between individual countries and regions, as well as providing a continental perspective on selected topics. Data can be filtered by demographic variables such as gender, age, and education level, enabling users to identify trends over time.

name: ICPAC: IGAD Climate Prediction and Applications Centre

fields.Org Full Name: ICPAC: IGAD Climate Prediction and Applications Centre
fields.Org Description: The IGAD Climate Prediction and Applications Centre (ICPAC) plays a vital role in the humanitarian context of the Greater Horn of Africa (GHA) by providing critical climate services to 11 countries. ICPAC's mission is to foster climate services and knowledge to enhance community resilience in a region highly susceptible to climate change and extreme weather events.

fields.Project/Product Name: Enhancing Early Warning Systems for Disaster Risk Reduction (E4DRR)
fields.Project Description: ICPAC and NORCAP are building hazard models, impact estimates, and climate storylines for drought and flood events in Eastern Africa. Using ensemble prediction systems, the project creates counterfactual, physically consistent event narratives and composite datasets to improve impact-based forecasting, anticipatory action, and loss-damage assessment. Integrated into the East Africa Hazard Watch Portal, this work fills data gaps, strengthens localized risk insights, and supports more effective disaster risk reduction across a region facing climate, conflict, and displacement pressures.

The Food Security and Nutrition Working Group (FSNWG) is a regional platform, currently co-chaired by ICPAC and FAO. It’s goal is two-fold: to provide an up-to-date food security and nutrition situation analysis (early warning) and to offer a forum to build consensus on critical issues facing policy and interventions. The FNSWG has served regional governments, donors, and non-governmental agencies since the early 2000’s. Current membership includes approximately 80 organisations (IGAD, UN agencies, NGOs, donors, and research institutions) who contribute to the operation of the working group, and its nutrition, markets, food security information, livestock and pastoralist sub-groups.

name: FAO: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations

fields.Org Full Name: FAO: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
fields.Org Description: The Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) is a specialized agency of the United Nations dedicated to leading global efforts to eliminate hunger. Established to improve nutrition, increase agricultural productivity, and raise the standard of living in rural populations, the FAO works with governments and partners worldwide. Its mission includes developing policies, sharing knowledge, and providing technical assistance to ensure food security and sustainable agricultural development for all. Through its initiatives, the FAO aims to create a world where everyone has regular access to enough high-quality food to lead active, healthy lives.
fields.Org IATI Name: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

fields.Project Description: This dataset contains information on countries, commodities, and markets, sourced from the World Food Programme Price Database. Due to the large volume of data, the actual food prices are provided in country-level datasets. The World Food Programme Price Database includes data on foods such as maize, rice, beans, fish, and sugar, covering 98 countries and approximately 3,000 markets. The database is updated weekly, though much of the data is reported on a monthly basis. Historical data is available as far back as 1992 for a few countries, while many others began reporting from 2003 or later.

Driven by regularly collected primary data, the objective of the Data in Emergencies (DIEM) Hub is to understand the impact of shocks in food crisis contexts and to inform decision-making in support of agricultural livelihoods. The DIEM Hub has been publicly available since June 2021.

FAO’s AQUASTAT is a global water information system that provides open-access data on water availability, irrigation, and usage. It supports analysis and decision-making related to food security, hydrology, and agricultural planning.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs (MEAE)
Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)
Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands (BZ / MFA)
Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC)
Ministry of Infrastructure and Water Management (IenW)

fields.Project/Product Name: GIEWS - Global Information and Early Warning System on Food and Agriculture
fields.Project Description: FAO’s GIEWS delivers near real-time crop and food supply monitoring, offering geospatial visualizations and drought alerts across over 100 countries. The data supports food security risk assessment and response planning.

The Food Security and Nutrition Working Group (FSNWG) is a regional platform, currently co-chaired by ICPAC and FAO. It’s goal is two-fold: to provide an up-to-date food security and nutrition situation analysis (early warning) and to offer a forum to build consensus on critical issues facing policy and interventions. The FNSWG has served regional governments, donors, and non-governmental agencies since the early 2000’s. Current membership includes approximately 80 organisations (IGAD, UN agencies, NGOs, donors, and research institutions) who contribute to the operation of the working group, and its nutrition, markets, food security information, livestock and pastoralist sub-groups.

fields.Org Description: University of California, Irvine was founded with a mission to catalyze the community and enhance lives through rigorous academics, cutting-edge research, and dedicated public service. Today, we draw on the unyielding spirit of our pioneering faculty, staff and students who arrived on campus with a dream to inspire change and generate new ideas. We believe that true progress is made when different perspectives come together to advance our understanding of the world around us. And we enlighten our communities and point the way to a better future. At UCI, we shine brighter.

fields.Project/Product Name: SWOT: The Safe Water Optimization Tool
fields.Project Description: The Safe Water Optimization Tool (SWOT) provides actionable, site-specific chlorination guidance by analysing routine water quality measurements and modelling chlorine decay from tapstands to households. Designed for use in emergencies, the tool supports responders in maintaining safe drinking water throughout distribution systems.

CLIFDEW-GRID, developed by UNHCR in collaboration with the University of California Irvine, is an ambitious initiative dedicated to addressing the complex challenge of climate-induced forced displacement, including through the creation of the first risk index of its kind. This project leverages advanced data analytics and innovative methodologies to enable CRAF’d ecosystem partners to anticipate and respond effectively to the escalating crisis of climate-induced displacement. By providing forecasts at a subnational level, CLIFDEW-GRID offers a more nuanced understanding of in-country heterogeneity compared to traditional country-level approaches. The system will be piloted in selected countries in Western and Eastern Africa.

CLIFDEW-GRID functions as an early warning, grid-based modeling system designed to predict potential climate-induced forced displacement. It is a joint, innovative data project led by UNHCR and the University of California Irvine, with financial support from the Complex Risk Analytics Fund (CRAF’d).

fields.Org Description: The University of St Andrews emphasizes rigorous teaching and research across the humanities, sciences, and social sciences, supporting scholarship through small-group instruction, historical academic traditions, and internationally oriented research in disciplines such as international relations, philosophy, and marine science.

fields.Project Description: PeaceRep distributes the PA-X Tracker, an innovative digital tool designed to provide data-driven insights that support peace and transition processes. The suite of PeaceTech tools within the PA-X Tracker enables users to track and monitor the progress and implementation of peace and transition initiatives. The Tracker offers a comprehensive understanding of how peace processes are unfolding, identifies the stakeholders involved, and assesses the impact of these processes across a range of institutional, political, economic, humanitarian, and security indicators.

fields.Org Description: The World Bank is an international financial institution that provides loans and grants to the governments of low- and middle-income countries for the purposes of economic development.
fields.Org IATI Name: The World Bank or World Bank Trust Funds

fields.Project Description: This platform curates and disseminates datasets, reports, and indicators related to fragility, conflict, and violence. It supports development and humanitarian actors by improving access to evidence on conflict dynamics and institutional resilience.

fields.Project/Product Name: World Bank Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS)
fields.Project Description: The World Bank Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS) is the World Bank’s flagship household survey initiative that provides high-quality, nationally representative panel data for analyzing poverty, inequality, and livelihoods. Datasets are downloadable through the World Bank Microdata Library and are used to support data-driven policymaking.

The Fragility Forum is a bi-annual event organized by the World Bank Group that brings together practitioners and policymakers from around the world to exchange knowledge and experience on engaging in environments affected by fragility, conflict, and violence.
The Famine Action Mechanism (FAM) is a global partnership dedicated to scaling up anticipatory and early action to protect lives and livelihoods from emerging food security crises.

The Global Crisis Risk Platform (GCRP) is an integrated analytics platform designed to assess and anticipate multidimensional crisis risks. It provides open-access dashboards, country risk profiles, and composite indicators to support anticipatory action and inform crisis financing decisions.

The Data Catalog is designed to make World Bank’s development data easy to find, download, use, and share. It includes data from the World Bank’s microdata, finances, and energy data platforms, as well as datasets from the open data catalog. There are different ways to access and download datasets.

fields.Project/Product Name: World Bank-UNHCR Joint Data Center on Forced Displacement
fields.Project Description: The World Bank-UNHCR Joint Data Center on Forced Displacement (JDC) is a joint initiative dedicated to improving the collection, analysis, and use of data on forcibly displaced populations. The JDC provides public goods such as surveys, microdata, and research, all focused on informing development and humanitarian action through evidence-based approaches.

The Microdata Library is a collection of datasets from the World Bank and other international, regional, and national organizations. The World Bank’s Microdata Library facilitates access to microdata collected through sample surveys of households, business establishments, or other facilities. These microdata provide information about people living in developing countries, their institutions, their environment, their communities, and the operation of their economies. Many of these datasets are available as open data; users should check the terms of use associated with each dataset.

fields.Org Description: World Peace Foundation is a center at Tufts University's The Fletcher School, that produces innovative research for nonviolent futures. The WPF redefines peace through research, advocacy and engagement that creates pathways for non-violent futures. Since 1910, when WPF was created, ideas about peace and how to attain it have evolved. Our contribution lies in research and outreach informed by principles of justice.

fields.Project Description: PeaceRep distributes the PA-X Tracker, an innovative digital tool designed to provide data-driven insights that support peace and transition processes. The suite of PeaceTech tools within the PA-X Tracker enables users to track and monitor the progress and implementation of peace and transition initiatives. The Tracker offers a comprehensive understanding of how peace processes are unfolding, identifies the stakeholders involved, and assesses the impact of these processes across a range of institutional, political, economic, humanitarian, and security indicators.

fields.Org Description: The Internal Displacement Monitoring Centre (IDMC) is the world's leading source of data and analysis on internal displacement. Since our establishment in 1998 as part of the Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC), we have offered a rigorous, independent and trusted service to the international community. Our work informs policy and operational decisions that improve the lives of the millions of people living in internal displacement, or at risk of becoming displaced in the future.
fields.Link to Data Products Overview:
GIDD: <https://www.internal-displacement.org/database/displacement-data/>
IDU: <https://www.internal-displacement.org/internal-displacement-updates/>
Good Practices Repository: [https://www.internal displacement.org/good-practices/](https://www.internal-displacement.org/good-practices/)
Severity Assessments: <https://www.internal-displacement.org/displacement-severity-assessments/>
<https://www.internal-displacement.org/displacement-risk/>
GRID: <https://www.internal-displacement.org/global-report/>

fields.Project Description: IDMC’s Internal Displacement Updates (IDU) offer preliminary, timely, and detailed insights into new displacement events, reflecting ongoing daily monitoring efforts. This event-based dataset provides initial snapshots of displacement trends, which may later be refined and consolidated in the Global Internal Displacement Database (GIDD). It is important to note that these figures do not undergo the same level of quality control as the GIDD data, as the IDU data reflects timely updates that are subject to change as more information becomes available following a displacement event.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)
Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT)

fields.Project Description: As part of IDMC's investment in more systematic monitoring of national and global efforts to reduce the risk, scale, and negative impacts of internal displacement, the Global Repository of Good Practices provides a platform to compile, share, and evaluate policies and programmatic approaches to support better solutions for internally displaced people worldwide.

IDMC conducts annual severity assessments to compare the living conditions of internally displaced households with those of returnee and non-displaced households within the same country. These assessments evaluate access to adequate housing, stable income, food security, and education, as well as the level of fear related to exposure to conflict or violence, explosive hazards, and other threats.

The Global Internal Displacement Database (GIDD) is the result of an annual process that includes the collection, harmonization, and validation of data, followed by a comprehensive peer review. The process involves engagement with primary data providers and relevant stakeholders at national, regional, and global levels. Published each year, the GIDD has been recognized in several United Nations resolutions for its importance. The database provides detailed data by country and year for conflict-induced displacement, while disaster-induced displacement is documented at the event level. Since 2023, additional disaggregated data has also been made available.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)
Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT)

fields.Project Description: IDMC’s Global Report on Internal Displacement (GRID) is the authoritative source for data and analysis on the state of internal displacement for the previous year. Each year, IDMC presents validated estimates of internal displacements caused by conflict and disasters, as well as the total cumulative numbers of internally displaced persons (IDPs) worldwide. The GRID also provides an overview of the year’s most significant internal displacement situations, highlighting potential measures to address the issue across the humanitarian, development, disaster risk reduction, and climate change agendas.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)
Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT)

fields.Org Description: ETH Zurich is founded on core Swiss values such as freedom, individual responsibility, entrepreneurial spirit, and open-mindedness. Established in 1855 as a center for innovation and knowledge, the university is home to the Weather and Climate Risks (WCR) Group. The WCR Group develops the CLIMADA platform, an open-source tool for probabilistic climate risk assessment and adaptation planning, and leads projects like scClim, which integrates weather predictions and climate simulations to assess hail impacts, and SPARCCLE, which models climate extremes and their effects on global ecosystems.

fields.Project Description: CLIMADA Platform is an open-source risk assessment tool designed to model economic losses resulting from natural hazards by utilizing hazard, exposure, and vulnerability data. It is intended to support decision-making in policy, research, and risk finance contexts.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)

name: World Bank-UNHCR Joint Data Center on Forced Displacement

fields.Org Full Name: World Bank-UNHCR Joint Data Center on Forced Displacement

fields.Project Description: Data Systems and Tools develop and strengthen innovative methods and platforms to improve the availability and quality of data on forcibly displaced populations. Activities include enhancing microdata access, advancing geospatial analytics, supporting global data platforms, and improving field data collection tools such as KoBoToolbox.

Data Collection and Surveys support the production of high-quality socioeconomic data by integrating refugees, internally displaced persons, and other forcibly displaced or stateless populations into national household surveys and censuses, strengthening the evidence base for development policy and humanitarian response.

Data Standards and Governance strengthens national and international statistical practices related to forced displacement by supporting the development of data governance recommendations, standard definitions, and harmonized methods. Activities include advancing statistical inclusion, improving microdata access, and enhancing UNHCR’s global registration systems.

fields.Org Description: Start Network is a network of aid agencies across the world, working together to revolutionise the global humanitarian system.

Latinobarómetro Corporation is a non-profit NGO based in Santiago, Chile, and is solely responsible for the production and publication of the data.
Latinobarómetro Corporation researches the development of democracy and economies as well as societies, using indicators of opinion, attitudes, behaviour and values. Its results are used by social and political actors, international organizations, governments and the media.
The executive director of the study is Marta Lagos.

fields.Project Description: Latinobarómetro is an annual public opinion survey that involves approximately 20,000 interviews in 18 Latin American countries, representing more than 600 million inhabitants. Some of the most relevant sections of the Latinobarómetro for freedom of expression and media development are "Democracy" and "Media, Internet and Social Media." Key topics include activities people like to do on the internet, perceptions of the use of private data for commercial purposes, and preferred social media platforms. The survey data is provided by Corporación Latinobarómetro.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Development Bank of Latin America and the Caribbean (CAF)
Global Affairs Canada (GAC) / Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development
fields.Agency Data Portal: Project Browser  International assistance projects funded by Global Affairs Canada https://w05.international.gc.ca/projectbrowser-banqueprojets/

fields.Project Description: The Latinobarómetro Online Analysis Platform enables users to explore and analyze data directly in their browser, without the need to download files or register. The platform is powered by JDSurvey, an analysis tool developed by JD Systems (Madrid), which is also responsible for maintaining the Latinobarómetro Data Archive.

fields.Org Description: Collaboration is Data2X’s guiding principle and signature way of working. This reflects our core strength: our convening power based on the trust we have earned from government, private sector, civil society, and academic partners. In the coming years, Data2X will play an even more active facilitator role, mobilizing stakeholders around a cooperative global approach to fill gender data gaps.

fields.Project Description: Data2X is a global partnership dedicated to advancing gender-responsive data systems. The organization develops research, advocacy, and tools to enhance data on women and girls, including initiatives focused on capacity strengthening and the provision of innovation grants.

name: IPC: Integrated Food Security Phase Classification

fields.Org Full Name: IPC: Integrated Food Security Phase Classification
fields.Org Description: The IPC global partnership is comprised of 19 organizations and inter-governmental institutions including Action Against Hunger (AAH), CARE International, Comité Permanent Inter-Etats de Lutte Contre la Sécheresse au Sahel (Permanent Interstate Committee for Drought Control in the Sahel) (CILSS), Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO), Famine Early Warning Systems Network (FEWS NET), the Global Food Security Cluster, the Global Nutrition Cluster, Intergovernmental Authority on Development (IGAD), Joint Research Centre (JRC) of the European Commission, Oxford Committee for Famine Relief (Oxfam), Southern African Development Community (SADC), Save the Children, Sistema de la Integración Centroamericana (Central American Integration System) (SICA), World Food Programme (WFP), United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF), the World Bank, the Wolrd Health Organization (WHO), UNDP and IFPRI.

fields.Project Description: It is an enhanced interactive interface that displays a map of all the countries where the IPC operates and provides the option to download population data.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Global Affairs Canada (GAC) / Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development
fields.Agency Data Portal: Project Browser  International assistance projects funded by Global Affairs Canada https://w05.international.gc.ca/projectbrowser-banqueprojets/

fields.Project Description: The IPC Population Tracking Tool is an online platform that provides public access to population data from more than 30 different countries. It enables users to download resource data for offline IPC analyses dating back to 2017. All national population figures are derived from official country population estimates, while IPC estimates are those published in country IPC reports.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Global Affairs Canada (GAC) / Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development
fields.Agency Data Portal: Project Browser  International assistance projects funded by Global Affairs Canada https://w05.international.gc.ca/projectbrowser-banqueprojets/

fields.Project Description: IPC Infographics provide regularly updated visual summaries of acute food insecurity and malnutrition across crisis-affected countries. Drawing on IPC analytical processes, these snapshots translate complex assessments into accessible, country-specific insights used by policymakers, humanitarian actors, and early warning systems to monitor hunger trends and guide response planning.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Global Affairs Canada (GAC) / Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development
fields.Agency Data Portal: Project Browser  International assistance projects funded by Global Affairs Canada https://w05.international.gc.ca/projectbrowser-banqueprojets/

fields.Project Description: The IPC Analytics Portal serves as the global public platform where official IPC food insecurity analyses and maps are published. It provides a single-entry point for accessing validated IPC classifications from around the world.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Global Affairs Canada (GAC) / Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development
fields.Agency Data Portal: Project Browser  International assistance projects funded by Global Affairs Canada https://w05.international.gc.ca/projectbrowser-banqueprojets/

fields.Org Description: The Pacific Community (SPC) is the principal scientific and technical organisation in the Pacific region, proudly supporting development since 1947. We are an international development organisation owned and governed by our 27 country and territory members. The Pacific Community supports sustainable development by applying a people-centred approach to science, research and technology across all of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). We serve our members by interweaving and harnessing the nexus of climate, ocean, land, culture, rights and good governance; through trusted partnerships; investing in Pacific people; and understanding Pacific contexts.

fields.Project Description: DisasterAWARE is a global platform that provides real-time hazard alerts, dashboards, and geospatial tools to support disaster preparedness and early warning. The platform integrates predictive models and hazard tracking using data from global datasets, enabling comprehensive monitoring and response to potential disasters.
This regional platform delivers open-access dashboards, geospatial tools, and statistics to support Pacific states with governance, climate resilience, and disaster response planning.

fields.Org Description: The United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) is the leading global authority on the environment. UNEP’s mission is to inspire, inform, and enable nations and peoples to improve their quality of life without compromising that of future generations.

fields.Project/Product Name: UN Environment Programme World Conservation Monitoring Centre (UNEP-WCMC)
fields.Project Description: UNEP-WCMC is a global science-policy interface that provides open-access datasets and tools on biodiversity, ecosystem services, and conservation strategies. Its data platforms support environmental reporting, climate resilience, and natural capital planning.

fields.Org Description: ACAPS, which originally stood for the "Assessment Capacities Project," is an independent, non-governmental organization that provides humanitarian information and analysis to support better-informed decision-making in crisis situations. It offers data and analysis on global humanitarian crises to organizations like the UN, humanitarian responders, and donors, with the goal of improving aid delivery and efficiency. ACAPS provides global analysis, and works with other organizations to improve evidence-based decision-making in humanitarian response.

fields.Project Description: The INFORM Severity Index is an improved method for analyzing the severity of humanitarian crises on a global scale. It aims to enhance the management of humanitarian crises by providing decision-makers with a comparable and reliable summary of information regarding the severity of such crises. This information is updated monthly and is applicable worldwide. Since 2016, INFORM partners have been developing the INFORM Severity Index to complement the widely used INFORM Risk Index.
The Global Humanitarian Access Overview is ACAPS’ twice-yearly assessment of the barriers that prevent aid from reaching people in crisis and people in crisis from receiving assistance.

The Risk Radar is a forward-looking analytical tool developed by ACAPS to identify countries and contexts where the humanitarian situation is likely to deteriorate significantly over the next six months. This tool integrates the monitoring of hundreds of crises, evaluates key drivers and triggers, and applies a systematic risk-analysis methodology—assessing both impact and probability—to highlight areas where urgent attention and preparedness may be required.

fields.Org Description: The University of Minnesota provides extensive data services and projects through various centers, including the Minnesota Research Data Center (MnRDC), which provides researchers secure access to non-public data from the U.S. Census Bureau and other government agencies. Their data services also encompass data infrastructure assessment, record linkage, machine learning, innovative data capture, and data access and preservation. The IPUMS Center for Data Integration is a prominent provider of census and survey data globally, further showcasing the University's commitment to data integration and research.

fields.Project Description: IPUMS provides harmonized, high-quality census and survey data from over 100 countries. Available through an open-access platform, its datasets enable global research on health, population trends, labor, and development outcomes.

name: UNITAR: UN Institute for Training and Research

fields.Org Full Name: UNITAR: UN Institute for Training and Research
fields.Org Description: UNITAR focuses on building capacity in the use of data for evidence-based decision-making, particularly in developing countries. They organize workshops and develop toolkits on governance for data ecosystems, with a special emphasis on supporting the implementation of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). UNITAR also helps strengthen statistical training at national and local levels, promotes access to statistical learning for data producers, enables the use of new data sources like citizen data, and enhances the effective use of data by policymakers and stakeholders through statistical literacy initiatives.

fields.Project/Product Name: Global Disaster Alert and Coordination System (GDACS)
fields.Project Description: The Global Disaster Alert and Coordination System (GDACS) is a cooperation framework between the United Nations, the European Commission, and disaster managers worldwide. Its purpose is to improve alerts, facilitate information exchange, and enhance coordination during the initial phase following major sudden-onset disasters.

fields.Org Description: IOM’s work is guided by a commitment to upholding the dignity, safety, and protection of individuals affected by crises, even in the most challenging response contexts worldwide. All activities are designed to respect the rights and needs of people in vulnerable situations, ensuring that humanitarian assistance is delivered with sensitivity, impartiality, and a focus on safeguarding those at risk. IOM prioritizes ethical standards and best practices to foster environments where affected populations are treated with respect and their well-being is central to every intervention.

fields.Project Description: The DTM IDP Baseline Assessment provides a census-style snapshot of displaced populations, documenting where IDPs, returnees, and migrants are located at administrative levels, along with population counts and basic demographic characteristics. It establishes the authoritative “who and where” baseline for displacement contexts.

DTM Site and Settlement Assessments provide granular, site-level data on displacement locations such as camps and informal settlements, including population figures, shelter conditions, service availability, and protection risks to guide operational responses.

The International Organization for Migration’s Global Data Institute introduces PRIMARI, an ambitious initiative designed to enhance understanding of global mobility by consolidating sub-national displacement data with migration insights. This project aims to create a composite dataset covering up to 60 countries, utilizing the extensive data resources of the Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM). PRIMARI is distinguished by its dedication to integrating diverse data streams into a single, accessible, and actionable dataset, supported by a comprehensive metadata repository to ensure data transparency and integrity.

DTM Flow Monitoring captures near-real-time data on population movements through key transit, entry, and exit points. It tracks volumes, directions, traveler profiles, reasons for movement, and intended destinations to understand mobility dynamics and emerging displacement routes.

DTM Returnee Monitoring documents the locations, numbers, and basic characteristics of populations returning to areas of origin after displacement. It supports analysis of return trends, reintegration conditions, and risks of secondary displacement.
The Migration Data Portal serves as a unique access point to timely, comprehensive migration statistics and reliable information about migration data on a global scale.

The Global Crisis Response Platform (GCRP) is a data and analytics platform that aggregates global risk indicators, country profiles, and dashboards to support early-warning, crisis preparedness, and financing decisions across development and humanitarian systems.

The Emergency Tracking Tool (ETT) is a rapid, event-triggered DTM mechanism that delivers near-real-time updates on sudden displacement caused by conflict or disasters, enabling immediate situational awareness during the first hours and days of a crisis.

DTM Service Mapping systematically maps the location, functionality, and accessibility of services and facilities—such as health, WASH, education, and humanitarian services—within displacement-affected areas to identify coverage gaps and support referrals.

fields.Project/Product Name: Humanitarian Data Science and Ethics Group (DSEG)
fields.Project Description: The Humanitarian Data Science and Ethics Group (DSEG) is a community of practice dedicated to advancing ethical, responsible, and inclusive data science within humanitarian contexts. The group supports the development and implementation of standards, tools, and guidance that prioritize protection principles and data accountability.

name: UNESCAP: United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific

fields.Org Full Name: UNESCAP: United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific
fields.Org Description: UNESCAP leverages data and statistics to address key development challenges in the Asia-Pacific region, providing member states with results-oriented projects, technical assistance, and capacity building. They work across various areas, including macroeconomic policy, poverty reduction, trade, environment, disaster risk reduction, and social development. UNESCAP promotes the use of data for evidence-based decision-making and fosters regional cooperation on transboundary issues, utilizing rigorous analysis and peer learning to inform policy dialogues and recommendations.
The mission of the Water Point Data Exchange (WPdx) is to unlock the potential of water point data to improve rural water services through evidence-based decision-making.

fields.Project Description: The Water Point Data Exchange (WPDx) platform is a global open data system that compiles and standardizes information on water point locations and characteristics from multiple countries. Hosted by the Global Water Challenge, it provides a critical repository for improving water service delivery by offering insights into functionality, service levels, and infrastructure gaps. WPDx data has been used by governments, NGOs, and development partners to enhance resource allocation, plan maintenance, and track progress toward water access goals, contributing to SDG 6.

fields.Org Description: The Partnership in Statistics for Development in the 21st Century (PARIS21) aims to improve the production, quality, availability, and use of statistics for informed decision making for sustainable development. It was established in 1999 by the United Nations, the European Commission, the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), the International Monetary Fund, and the World Bank as a response to the need for accurate and reliable data to achieve and track progress toward development goals.

fields.Project Description: An online learning platform that offers training, MOOCs, and webinars focused on statistical capacity building and data system strengthening to support evidence-based policymaking.

ADAPT assists governments in assessing their statistical capacity, planning national data strategies, and making cost-effective investments in data infrastructure. It supports Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) tracking and capacity development in low- and middle-income countries.

fields.Project/Product Name: Guidelines for National Strategy for the Development of Statistics (NSDS)
fields.Project Description: The Guidelines for National Strategy for the Development of Statistics (NSDS) by PARIS21 provide structured guidance and tools to assist countries in designing national statistics strategies, aligning donor support, and integrating data systems for sustainable development planning.
An analytical platform that tracks country-level data system development and SDG readiness, providing dashboards and indicators to support the alignment of donor assistance with national priorities.

This is a global platform that tracks investments in national statistical systems. It offers open-access monitoring of resource flows, donor commitments, and financing gaps related to data for development.

fields.Org Description: The University of Oxford supports researchers and students with a suite of data services, primarily through the Bodleian Data Service, which offers access to statistics and data for secondary use. Oxford also provides research data management services for storing, publishing, and preserving research data outputs. Their Data Reporting, Architecture and Modelling (DRAM) team within IT Services offers comprehensive support for data management, analysis, and reporting, guided by the University IT Strategic Plan and Data Strategy.

fields.Project Description: The global Multidimensional Poverty Index (global MPI) is an annual international measure of acute multidimensional poverty that covers over 100 developing countries. It complements traditional monetary poverty measures by capturing the acute, overlapping deprivations in health, education, and living standards that people in poverty experience. The global MPI is computed by the Oxford Poverty and Human Development Initiative (OPHI) in partnership with the Human Development Report Office of the United Nations Development Programme.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Global Affairs Canada (GAC) / Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development
fields.Agency Data Portal: Project Browser  International assistance projects funded by Global Affairs Canada https://w05.international.gc.ca/projectbrowser-banqueprojets/

fields.Org Description: iMMAP Inc. is an international nonprofit organization that provides information management services to humanitarian and development organizations, enabling partners to make informed decisions that ultimately provide high-quality targeted assistance to the world’s most vulnerable populations.

fields.Project Description: The humanitarian crisis in Nigeria’s northeast states of Borno, Adamawa and Yobe (BAY) continues to severely affect millions of people who remain vulnerable to displacement, impoverishment, and threat of violence. What started as a localized insurgency more than eleven years ago has turned into a regional armed conflict with civilians, mostly women and children bearing the brunt of brutal clashes and attacks.

The iMMAP Inc. global surge team consists of over 400 highly qualified and diverse national and international technical information management (IM) specialists. When required, iMMAP Inc. deploys experts on mission who combine technical IM skills with sectoral and programmatic experience in areas such as Coordination, Food Security, Health, Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH), Protection, Nutrition, Cash, market and value chain analysis, context and geopolitical analysis, assessments, research, and more. These deployments are designed to improve country, regional, and global decision-making and planning processes in alignment with the Humanitarian Programme Cycle (HPC) principles.

The Multi-Sectoral Needs Assessment (MSNA) is a standardized, country-level data collection initiative designed to capture comprehensive multi-sectoral needs among crisis-affected populations. Implemented by IMPACT Initiatives through its REACH Initiative, the MSNA collects statistically representative, household-level data on sectors such as food security, health, shelter, WASH, education, and protection. While the initiative is closely coordinated with OCHA and humanitarian clusters in country-led responses, the technical design, survey implementation, and analysis are primarily led by REACH/IMPACT, with operational support from agencies like IOM , WFP or IMMAP.

fields.Org Description: The World Health Organization (WHO) aims to achieve the highest attainable standard of health for all people worldwide, defining health as a state of complete physical, mental, and social well-being, not merely the absence of disease or infirmity. Its primary functions include promoting the control of epidemic and endemic diseases, enhancing education and training in public health and medical treatment, and establishing international standards for biological products. The WHO works globally to improve health outcomes and foster cooperation among nations in addressing health challenges.

fields.Project Description: WHO offers globally standardized health data through its GHO portal, providing indicators on disease, mortality, and service coverage via APIs and downloadable data under open access licenses.

The Global Health Observatory (GHO) is the World Health Organization’s flagship global portal for health statistics and indicators. It provides datasets across themes such as mortality, disease burden, and service coverage, with API access available for researchers and policymakers.

Epidemic Intelligence from Open Sources (EIOS) is a real-time platform developed by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the European Commission to collect, verify, and share public health threat information from open sources. The platform provides a centralized dashboard and alerting system designed to assist health agencies in monitoring emerging epidemics and coordinating responses.

fields.Project/Product Name: WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme for Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene (JMP)
fields.Project Description: Tracks access to water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) using global indicators and household survey data accessible under open access licenses.

fields.Project/Product Name: Surveillance System for Attacks on Health Care (SSA)
fields.Project Description: The Surveillance System for Attacks on Health Care (SSA) platform, developed by WHO, collects data on incidents that threaten health care in conflict settings. It provides dashboards and data to support protection analysis.
The HeRAMS Initiative aims to ensure that core information on essential health resources and services is readily available to decision makers at country, regional, and global levels.
MAP provides high-resolution maps of malaria risk and stability, combining epidemiological and environmental data to support global health planning, investment, and disease modeling.

The World Health Organization (WHO) Health Emergency Dashboard is a platform designed to share information about public health events and emergencies. The data on the dashboard is refreshed every thirty (30) minutes, and the information is accurate as of the time of the latest update.

fields.Project/Product Name: Early Warning, Alert and Response System (EWARS)
fields.Project Description: The Early Warning, Alert and Response System (EWARS) provides real-time monitoring of epidemic outbreaks. It supports crisis response planning and risk assessment through the use of online reporting platforms and dashboards.

name: RCCC: Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre

fields.Org Full Name: RCCC: Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre
fields.Org Description: The Climate Centre focuses primarily on providing guidance and tools to National Societies and their partners, and fostering the exchange of experience, training and technical back-up for Red Cross Red Crescent volunteers, delegates and managers specializing in the management of disaster risk and health.
fields.Org IATI Name: Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre

fields.Project Description: The Regional Climate Change Conference (RCCC) convenes regional and global stakeholders in Bangkok and online to address resilience and climate change adaptation, with a focus on inclusive and sustainable communities. Through keynotes, panels, workshops, and capacity-building activities, it promotes knowledge exchange, climate finance and entrepreneurship, community-led adaptation, and inter-regional policy dialogue.

A new generation risk data initiative is shining a light on where climate, conflict, and displacement risks collide across sub-Saharan Africa, North Africa, and the Middle East (MENA). By integrating these drivers into one analytical stream, it delivers actionable insights tailored to conflict-affected and climate-vulnerable populations, filling critical gaps and enabling anticipatory action. Led by the Red Cross Red Crescent Climate Centre, together with the Netherlands Red Cross’ 510 Initiative and the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC), the risk data supports more informed and anticipatory decision-making across the humanitarian system.

name: ECMWF: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts

fields.Org Full Name: ECMWF: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
fields.Org Description: The European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts (ECMWF) is both a research institute and a 24/7 operational service, providing global numerical weather predictions and related data to its Member and Co-operating States, as well as the wider community. ECMWF operates a world-class supercomputer facility dedicated to weather forecasting and maintains one of the largest meteorological data archives in the world. Its strategic activities also include delivering advanced training and supporting the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) in the implementation of its programmes.

fields.Project/Product Name: Copernicus Emergency Management Service Annual Conference
fields.Project Description: The Copernicus Emergency Management Service Annual Conference is a key event that brings together experts, stakeholders, and decision-makers from across Europe and beyond. The conference provides a platform for sharing knowledge, discussing best practices, and exploring the latest developments in emergency management. Participants engage in presentations, panel discussions, and interactive sessions focused on the use of Copernicus data and services in disaster risk reduction, preparedness, response, and recovery. The event highlights the impact of Copernicus Emergency Management Service products and fosters collaboration among the emergency management community, policy makers, and scientific experts.

Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S) provides authoritative, open-access climate data and tools, including forecasts, historical datasets, and impact indicators. Managed by ECMWF, it supports risk analysis, adaptation planning, and policy development globally.

The Copernicus Atmosphere Monitoring Service (CAMS) provides global, quality-controlled information on air pollution, greenhouse gases, solar energy, and climate forcing. Implemented by ECMWF on behalf of the European Commission, the service integrates satellite and in-situ observations with advanced modelling to support environmental monitoring and public-facing applications across Europe and beyond.

name: DPO: United Nations Department of Peace Operations

fields.Org Full Name: DPO: United Nations Department of Peace Operations
fields.Org Description: The UN Department of Peace Operations (DPO) utilizes data to enhance the effectiveness of peace operations and inform decision-making in conflict and post-conflict settings. They manage the UN Peace and Security Data Hub, a public library of datasets on peace and security, providing centralized access to up-to-date information. The Hub empowers a wide range of users, including UN staff, member states, academia, and the public, with data on peacekeeping mandates, quick impact projects, and other related initiatives. DPO also engages in data-related projects such as predictive modeling with peacekeeping demographic data and quantifying the implementation of the Women, Peace and Security agenda through text analysis.

fields.Project Description: A centralized data library that offers curated conflict-related datasets, published by the UN Department of Peace Operations (DPO), to support analytic peace and security programming.

fields.Org Description: INFORM is a collaboration of the Inter-Agency Standing Committee Reference Group on Risk, Early Warning and Preparedness and the European Commission. INFORM is developing a suite of quantitative, analytical products to support decision-making on humanitarian crises and disasters.

fields.Project Description: The INFORM Severity Index is an improved method for analyzing the severity of humanitarian crises on a global scale. It aims to enhance the management of humanitarian crises by providing decision-makers with a comparable and reliable summary of information regarding the severity of such crises. This information is updated monthly and is applicable worldwide. Since 2016, INFORM partners have been developing the INFORM Severity Index to complement the widely used INFORM Risk Index.

INFORM Climate Change Risk Index is an upgrade of the INFORM Risk Index as it includes climate and socio-economic projections. It provides quantified estimates of the impacts of climate change on the future risk of humanitarian crises and disasters. The results are intended to inform policy choices across climate mitigation, climate adaptation, disaster risk reduction, sustainable development, and humanitarian assistance.

INFORM Warning is a state-of-the-art, innovative global risk monitoring tool designed to anticipate complex risks up to a year in advance, directly linked to crisis funding instruments. It transcends traditional methods by presenting multi-hazard information from diverse sources. Its unique analysis offers insights into risk trends, forecasts, scenarios, and potential events leading to crisis impact.

The INFORM Risk Index is a multi-hazard risk assessment tool developed by the Inter-Agency Standing Committee (IASC) and the European Commission. It combines data on hazards, vulnerability, and coping capacity to produce a composite score of disaster risk in over 190 countries. The index supports evidence-based disaster preparedness, humanitarian planning, and crisis response by identifying countries most at risk of crises that could overwhelm national response capacities. It is updated annually and incorporates more than 50 indicators.

The INFORM Risk Index is a multi-hazard risk assessment tool developed by the Inter-Agency Standing Committee (IASC) and the European Commission. It combines data on hazards, vulnerability, and coping capacity to produce a composite score of disaster risk in over 190 countries. The index supports evidence-based disaster preparedness, humanitarian planning, and crisis response by identifying countries most at risk of crises that could overwhelm national response capacities. It is updated annually and incorporates more than 50 indicators.

fields.Org Description: As an international organization, HERA is dedicated to supporting other humanitarian and development organizations in the implementation of their projects and operational strategies. This includes crafting strategic frameworks, establishing security policies, risk assessment, donor mapping, exploratory missions, and evaluation missions. HERA assists organizations in understanding the evolving landscape of the humanitarian system, particularly regarding epidemic control through epidemiological data collection and climate change adaptation by aiding organizations in measuring their carbon footprint and developing strategies to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

fields.Project Description: HERA Data Collection provides detailed epidemiological datasets to support targeted health interventions, sharing comprehensive Covid-19 and Ebola data for Africa through the Humanitarian Data Exchange. By aggregating, validating, and updating reliable outbreak information, the initiative strengthens situational awareness for humanitarian and public health actors.

HERA supports NGOs in their development by assisting with the creation of strategic frameworks, annual action plans, exploratory missions, project evaluations, security package implementation, and risk assessments. This comprehensive support enables organizations to enhance their effectiveness and achieve their goals.

fields.Org Description: Insecurity Insight examines threats facing people living and working in dangerous environments. Our innovative data collection and analysis methods generate insights relevant for aid workers, aid agencies and those concerned with the protection of health workers, educators, IDPs and refugees. Our aim is to empower those who deliver vital services and to give voices to those affected by insecurity

fields.Project Description: Insecurity Insight examines threats facing people living and working in dangerous environments. The organization uses innovative data collection and analysis methods to generate insights relevant for aid workers, aid agencies, and those concerned with the protection of health workers, educators, internally displaced persons (IDPs), and refugees. The aim is to empower those who deliver vital services and to give a voice to those affected by insecurity.

fields.Agency/Department Name: Directorate-General for European Civil Protection and Humanitarian Aid Operations (DG ECHO)
Spanish Agency for International Development Cooperation (AECID)
Agencia Vasca de Cooperación para el Desarrollo / eLankidetza

name: LSE: London School of Economics and Political Science

fields.Org Full Name: LSE: London School of Economics and Political Science
fields.Org Description: The London School of Economics and Political Science concentrates on the study of societies, markets, and governance, producing research in economics, politics, sociology, and international relations, and shaping policy through empirical analysis, comparative institutional study, and global-facing intellectual networks.

fields.Project Description: PeaceRep distributes the PA-X Tracker, an innovative digital tool designed to provide data-driven insights that support peace and transition processes. The suite of PeaceTech tools within the PA-X Tracker enables users to track and monitor the progress and implementation of peace and transition initiatives. The Tracker offers a comprehensive understanding of how peace processes are unfolding, identifies the stakeholders involved, and assesses the impact of these processes across a range of institutional, political, economic, humanitarian, and security indicators.
